importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe from early 2025 to mid-October 2025 marks the period during which multiple charges and trials related to prison staff misconduct and inmate deaths were unfolding in New York.

keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the beating death of inmate Robert Brooks.
Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with multiple offenses including second-degree gang assault and false instrument filing.
The body-camera footage, though silent, captured a violent and unconcerned beating of Brooks, which became central to the prosecution’s case and sparked public outrage.
The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang and showed a 'depraved indifference to human life,' supporting murder charges for Kingsley and the broader pattern of misconduct.
Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault, was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility, with the fatal beating occurring in the infirmary.

Six of the 10 guards indicted in February faced murder charges; five had previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and one pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor related to attempted tampering with evidence.
Special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick took over the case due to recusal by Attorney General Letitia James, who represented officers in civil lawsuits.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards in the March 2025 beating and death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility.

namedEntities.name: David Kingsley

namedEntities.name: Nicholas Kieffer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former prison guard acquitted of murder and first-degree manslaughter
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was charged with murder, gang assault, and filing a false instrument, but found not guilty; he pepper sprayed the inmate during the incident.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks, who was attacked three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage, showed guards inflicting severe injuries—leading to a public outcry and strong prosecution claims that the guards acted as a gang with 'depraved indifference to human life.' Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with multiple offenses, including gang assault. The case is notable for the role of special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick, who took over due to recusal by Attorney General Letitia James, and who is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 2025 beating and death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at a nearby prison, indicating a broader pattern of inmate abuse within the state’s correctional system.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
